definition: betrayal/defection/turncoat/to change sides politically
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I'll burn him, and show the north how I deal with turncloaks and traitors .
sentences.chinese: 我会烧了他，以示北境我是如何处理叛徒和变节者的。

sentences.english: Little imagine Zhang Wanchuan defection, already become a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 殊不知张万川早已变节，成为叛徒。

sentences.english: I'm a renegade, a turncoat, a Scalawag.
sentences.chinese: 我是个叛徒，变节者，流氓。

sentences.english: Do not proselytize your work or ideas.
sentences.chinese: 不要变节你的工作或观念。

sentences.english: The most furious anarchist become the most barefaced apostate .
sentences.chinese: 最激烈的无政府主义者，居然成了最露骨的变节者。

sentences.english: The technological process for making narrow-leaf heLix with varying pitches was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍一种窄片状变节距螺旋零件的扭制加工工艺。

sentences.english: Some people switch allegiances more often than they change their wardrobe.
sentences.chinese: 有些人时常变节，比他们变换衣柜里的衣裳还要频密。
